text: Demaryius Antwon Thomas (December 25, 1987 â€“ December 9, 2021) was an American football wide receiver. He played in the National Football League (NFL) for ten seasons. He mainly played for the Denver Broncos. With this team, Thomas made four Pro Bowls and won Super Bowl 50. Thomas was found dead at his home in Roswell, Georgia, on December 9, 2021, at age 33. He had health problems after a car crash in 2019. In July 2022, his brain was examined and found it had stage 2 chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE). ==References== Category:1987 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Denver Broncos players Category:Houston Texans players Category:New England Patriots players Category:New York Jets players Category:American football wide receivers Category:Sportspeople from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Deaths from chronic traumatic encephalopathy
title: Demaryius Thomas
